definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: This kind of person is incontrollable oneself feeling, often be angry grouch.
sentences.chinese: 這種人不能控制自己的感情，常發怒鬧脾氣。

sentences.english: Would you stop driving?The kid is annoyed.
sentences.chinese: 你先不要開車了好嗎？孩子在鬧脾氣呢。

sentences.english: Forget everything you may have read about coping with children's temper tantrums.
sentences.chinese: 忘了以前看過的那些應付小孩鬧脾氣的方法吧。

definition: to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
